results.message: Remove this commented out code.
Make 'stackList' 'readonly'.
Make this field 'private' and encapsulate it in a 'public' property.
Make this field 'private' and encapsulate it in a 'public' property.
Make 'address' 'readonly'.
Make 'outputList' 'readonly'.
Rename 'result' which hides the field with the same name.
Make 'logger' 'readonly'.
Remove this commented out code.
Remove this commented out code.
Merge this if statement with the enclosing one.
Change this condition so that it does not always evaluate to 'true'.
Remove the unused private field 'address'.
Refactor this method to reduce its Cognitive Complexity from 21 to the 15 allowed.
Refactor this method to reduce its Cognitive Complexity from 53 to the 15 allowed.
Refactor this method to reduce its Cognitive Complexity from 35 to the 15 allowed.
Make sure using this hardcoded IP address '192.168.12.42' is safe here.
Remove the field 'result' and declare it as a local variable in the relevant methods.
Remove the field 'result' and declare it as a local variable in the relevant methods.
Merge this if statement with the enclosing one.
Use a StringBuilder instead.
Make this method private or simplify its parameters to not use multidimensional/jagged arrays.
Return an empty collection instead of null.
Return an empty collection instead of null.
Use 'string.IsNullOrEmpty()' instead of comparing to empty string.
Remove the unused local variable 'resp'.

S1066.fullDescription: Merging collapsible if statements increases the code’s readability.

S1104.shortDescription: Fields should not have public accessibility
S1104.fullDescription: Public fields in public classes do not respect the encapsulation principle and has three main disadvantages:

S1117.shortDescription: Local variables should not shadow class fields
S1117.fullDescription: Overriding or shadowing a variable declared in an outer scope can strongly impact the readability, and therefore the maintainability, of a piece of code. Further, it could lead maintainers to introduce bugs because they think they’re using one variable but are really using another.

S1144.shortDescription: Unused private types or members should be removed
S1144.fullDescription: private or internal types or private members that are never executed or referenced are dead code: unnecessary, inoperative code that should be removed. Cleaning out dead code decreases the size of the maintained codebase, making it easier to understand the program and preventing bugs from being introduced.

S1168.shortDescription: Empty arrays and collections should be returned instead of null
S1168.fullDescription: Returning null instead of an actual array, collection or map forces callers of the method to explicitly test for nullity, making them more complex and less readable.

S125.shortDescription: Sections of code should not be commented out
S125.fullDescription: Programmers should not comment out code as it bloats programs and reduces readability.

S1313.shortDescription: Using hardcoded IP addresses is security-sensitive
S1313.fullDescription: Hardcoding IP addresses is security-sensitive. It has led in the past to the following vulnerabilities:

S1450.shortDescription: Private fields only used as local variables in methods should become local variables
S1450.fullDescription: When the value of a private field is always assigned to in a class' methods before being read, then it is not being used to store class information. Therefore, it should become a local variable in the relevant methods to prevent any misunderstanding.

S1481.shortDescription: Unused local variables should be removed
S1481.fullDescription: If a local variable is declared but not used, it is dead code and should be removed. Doing so will improve maintainability because developers will not wonder what the variable is used for.

S1643.shortDescription: Strings should not be concatenated using '+' in a loop
S1643.fullDescription: StringBuilder is more efficient than string concatenation, especially when the operator is repeated over and over as in loops.

S2368.shortDescription: Public methods should not have multidimensional array parameters
S2368.fullDescription: Exposing methods with multidimensional array parameters requires developers to have advanced knowledge about the language in order to be able to use them. Moreover, what exactly to pass to such parameters is not intuitive. Therefore, such methods should not be exposed, but can be used internally.

S2589.shortDescription: Boolean expressions should not be gratuitous
S2589.fullDescription: If a boolean expression doesn’t change the evaluation of the condition, then it is entirely unnecessary, and can be removed. If it is gratuitous because it does not match the programmer’s intent, then it’s a bug and the expression should be fixed.

S2933.shortDescription: Fields that are only assigned in the constructor should be "readonly"
S2933.fullDescription: readonly fields can only be assigned in a class constructor. If a class has a field that’s not marked readonly but is only set in the constructor, it could cause confusion about the field’s intended use. To avoid confusion, such fields should be marked readonly to make their intended use explicit, and to prevent future maintainers from inadvertently changing their use.

S3256.fullDescription: Using string.Equals to determine if a string is empty is significantly slower than using string.IsNullOrEmpty() or checking for string.Length == 0. string.IsNullOrEmpty() is both clear and concise, and therefore preferred to laborious, error-prone, manual null- and emptiness-checking.

S3776.shortDescription: Cognitive Complexity of methods should not be too high
S3776.fullDescription: Cognitive Complexity is a measure of how hard the control flow of a method is to understand. Methods with high Cognitive Complexity will be difficult to maintain.
